content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: IDVAR
      operator: non_empty
    - name: IDVARVAL
      operator: empty
Core:
  Id: CORE-000135
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Raise an error when IDVAR is not empty and IDVARVAL is empty.
Outcome:
  Message: IDVAR is not empty but IDVARVAL is empty.
  Output Variables:
    - IDVAR
    - IDVARVAL
    - QNAM
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0204
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: A record in a SUPP-- dataset relates back to its parent
                  record(s) via the key identified  by the STUDYID, RDOMAIN, USUBJID,
                  and IDVAR/IDVARVAL variables. An exception is SUPP-- dataset  records
                  that are related to Demographics (DM) records, where both IDVAR
                  and IDVARVAL will be  null because the key variables STUDYID, RDOMAIN,
                  and USUBJID are sufficient to identify the unique  parent record
                  in DM (DM has one record per USUBJID)
                Document: SDTMIG v3.4
                Section: 8.4.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - RELATIONSHIP
  Domains:
    Include:
      - SUPP--

json.Description: Raise an error when IDVAR is not empty and IDVARVAL is empty.

Outcome.Message: IDVAR is not empty but IDVARVAL is empty.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: A record in a SUPP-- dataset relates back to its parent record(s) via the key identified  by the STUDYID, RDOMAIN, USUBJID, and IDVAR/IDVARVAL variables. An exception is SUPP-- dataset  records that are related to Demographics (DM) records, where both IDVAR and IDVARVAL will be  null because the key variables STUDYID, RDOMAIN, and USUBJID are sufficient to identify the unique  parent record in DM (DM has one record per USUBJID)
